bill.summary: 9/22/2004--Passed House amended. Expresses the sense of Congress that it is appropriate to annually observe Patriot Day, September 11, with voluntary acts of service and compassion in honor of the lives lost on that day in 2001 in the terrorist attack on the United States and in the spirit of selflessness and unity demonstrated by those who participated in the rescue, recovery, and voluntary service activities that day.
